column11: ACI Names in ARS Ops Spec.
column12:
<P>ARS Operating Spec. Section 6.3</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>There are one new and one altered new ACI names in DIS 2 according to the differences listing for the DIS 2 gif file, but these changes are not specifically reflected in the spec, AS USUAL, as for some unknown reason the designers of these ARS Spec. documents choose to&nbsp;show all of the info. relating to the ACIs - location, platform, berths and direction of departure, but NOT the most important bit - the ACI name that the signaller (and tester) needs to type in on his keyboard to turn the thing on! </P>
<P>As such, there is also therefore nowhere to record the fact that this addition/change has been tested, and is presumably deficient as far as the SWTH is concerned. Can we either include an ACI Name&nbsp;column in the table in Section 6.3 or obtain a dispensation from NR to say they are happy with us not testing and recording the functionality of new and altered ACI for this project?</P>

column12:
<P>During Polmont site rehearsal there were problems with auto and replacement buttons.</P>
<P>All Bo'ness auto and replacement buttons worked correctly. None of Polness auto and replacement buttons worked ( with the exception of 515 signal ).&nbsp; To assist the designers, I have written below the flag operation taken from the RII monitoring tool attached to the IECC in the lab.</P>
<P><STRONG>Bo'ness&nbsp;replacement button:-</STRONG></P>
<P>button pulled = LPB542EBN unset</P>
<P>button pushed = LPB542EBN set</P>
<P><STRONG>Polmont replacement button:-</STRONG></P>
<P>button pulled = LPJ501EFMX sets then unsets, LPJ501EBN unset</P>
<P>button pushed = LPJ501EF sets then unsets, LPJ501EBN set</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P><STRONG>Bo'ness&nbsp;auto button:-</STRONG></P>
<P>button pushed = SPB543 auto set</P>
<P>button pulled = SPB 543 auto unset</P>
<P><STRONG>Polmont auto button:-</STRONG></P>
<P>button pushed = LPJ504AUTOFM set then unset, SPJ504 auto set</P>
<P>button pulled = LPJ504AUTOFMX set&nbsp;, unset then set , unset , SPJ 504 auto unset</P>

<P>Groundframe 276</P>
<P>(Prev test logs 29, 53, 57)</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Now will not operate with P658 occupied.....possible auxilliary data fault/mismatch<STRONG>-<EM>STET this was due to timer works ok.</EM></STRONG></P>
<P>Also not happy with how tracks will display with passage of a train through ground frame.&nbsp; Currently P656 displays normal lie A-C (with the track section break for ground frame) when train routed toward PB542 and occupying P658 but when&nbsp;operate GF reverse normal passage of a train over groundframe will also occupy (flood) P656.&nbsp; Is there no way of indicating C-B (reverse) in the same way that the A-C is done?&nbsp; </P>
<P>I realise there are no subroutes but it may look misleading to the signaller if we are showing lie of track/ground frame in one direction and not the other.</P>

column11: Additional berths on screens for Newcraighall station
column12:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt; mso-outline-level: 1" class=MsoNormal><B><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Tahoma','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB" lang=EN-US>From:</SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Tahoma','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB" lang=EN-US> Rowan Dixon <BR><B>Sent:</B> 04 September 2012 18:13<BR><B>To:</B> Anthony Talib<BR><B>Cc:</B> Nathan Nunnick; Rebecca Brook<BR><B>Subject:</B> Millerhill - screen layout</SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Tony,</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Having got a first-pass of the SIM working, I've found a problem with the supplied screen layouts that the signallers will object in strongest terms&nbsp; to.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>There are trains every 30 mins to Newcraighall station.&nbsp; Some turn round in the station, some continue to the turnback siding, and turn round there.&nbsp; When a train steps into the station (from signal EM30 on the Up/Down Millerhill line) on detail view 6, it is absurd that its description is no longer visible at the top left of that view, but the signaller must look at the bottom right of detail view 3.&nbsp; But, if the train ACIs to form a return working, that description IS on view 6, but NOT on view 3.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>To make matters worse, the same split occurs between overviews 1 and 2.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>The two berths at either end of Newcraighall station must be shown on BOTH views.&nbsp; They are just as important to be kept together as the two berths IN the turnback siding - and no-one would think of putting the bufferstops berth on one view, and the other berth on another.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Rowan</FONT></FONT></P>

column12:
<P>DIS2: TD Stepping from Millerhill/Newcraighall. </P>
<P>I understand that the new stepping in&nbsp;IECC A&nbsp;is effectively&nbsp;like for like with the current Millerhill TD, but can't understand why berths MA21(M021), M023 and M025&nbsp;seem to be transmitted to Edin B&nbsp;unconditionally for any and all trains&nbsp;but then the contents of MNA1, which is displayed as the Millerhill Approach on Edin B TD map MHPB,&nbsp; is only transmitted conditionally&nbsp;if R25-1 route is set.</P>
<P>MNA1 is only copied into from M025, not M021 and M023, thus it appears that this Approach Berth display on MHPB map&nbsp;will actually lag behind the displays of M021/23/25 and therefore render it ineffective. Is this how it works today and will it therefore be acceptable to NR?&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>
column25: <P>Designers comment accepted.</P>

<P>to allow this to happen. This will also require RII Control Table alterations.</P>

column22:
<P>No change - the limits of correlation for the screen design have been recorded in the design log as: </P>
<P><EM>The limits of correlation for the screen design on scheme plan 11-SC-0028 are:<BR>Down Goods ΓÇô EM587 Signal.<BR>Up Goods ΓÇô283/276 Track Circuit Joint.<BR>Up/Down Branch (Millerhill South Junction) ΓÇô full correlation/update.<BR>Down Branch (Niddrie South Junction) ΓÇô 143/341 Track Circuit Joint.<BR>Up Branch (Niddrie South Junction) ΓÇô 148/346 Track Circuit Joint.<BR>Up/Down Millerhill ΓÇô EP603 Signal.</EM></P>
<P><EM></EM>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Adding Niddrie West Junction would therefore be considered out of scope.</P>
<P>Adding Niddrie South Junction could be considered in scope but as mentioned there are space issues (especially on overview 2).</P>
<P>This would also make the junction labelling on detail view 6 incosistent.</P>
<P>I have discussed this with the CRE and it has been agreed&nbsp;that the screen design should remain unchanged but&nbsp;an entry made in the design log highlighting the inconsistency between detail view 3 and detail view 6. </P>

column12: <P>The response to the previous test log is totally unacceptable and means that the TD Stepping cannot be completed fully and signed for on form TC30 as part of the FAT and the previous log cannot be closed out. TD Block Schematics have been around long before IECC was even invented, so they are not "just for Data Prep" but form an important part of the testing documentation and therefore must be in line with the requirements of the Signalling Works Testing Handbook, in particular the section about showing discrete testing check marks for each individual test performed, hence the commoning up use of node points must not be used. Other methods are available, including the use of miniature route boxes on the block schematic&nbsp;to show the destination of a TD step.</P>
column25: This has been discussed and discussions will take place to resolve the situation.

column11: DIS 4 328C berth has wrong ownership attribute.
column12:
<P>DIS 4 TD stepping. </P>
<P>The berth ownership of 328C appears to be wrong. 328C should be received&nbsp;over the CTRL link but instead can be interposed into from Wksn 4. This means the TD stepping associated with this berth works incorrectly. Nathan says the gif file is wrong for this berth. This berth is also missing from the Early Transmission section of the ECS Spec.</P>
column25: Re-tested and working correctly now.

column11: DIS 4 TD Berth 328C is missing form Early Transmission section of ECS Spec.

<P>I can't see any reason why this berth is any different in operation to the other&nbsp; xxxC approach berths and would have expected it to be in there. The stepping for this berth does not work correctly as per the other approach berths (see also Test Log 1).</P>

Unfortunately, checking the data it seems these typos have been perpetuated there as well, hence these two steps are not tranmsitted to RCCS as they should be.</P>

column12:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>During updates made by DeltaRail for ALE-60 (Non-preferred routes selectable by DIS commands<B><I> - </I></B>&nbsp;The Contractor shall ensure that all non-preferred routes are to be made available to the operators in order to improve train regulation) it was identified that two preferred/ non-preferred route pairs in interlocking ASHBA (R607C-2 &amp; R607C-1, and R609XC-2 &amp; R609XC-1) do not have the standard interlocking controls or panel requests to allow the non-preferred routes to be selectable by DIS.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>In both examples the non-preferred route requests (QR607C-1 and QR609XC-1 respectively) do not appear to test the reminders on the route entrances and exits. This seems to be as designed ΓÇô both these non-preferred routes only being accessible by the interlocking if the conditions for the preferred route do not exist i.e. it is not intended for the external control system (DIS) to issue the non-preferred route request to the interlocking.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>This question has come about due to the existing IECC data (pre-ALE stage 2 updates) having route R609XC-1 (the non-preferred route) accessible to the signaller via keyboard command. DeltaRail require confirmation from Invensys that the SSI data in question for these routes is correct. DeltaRail intend to update the DIS as part of stage 2 to remove the functionality for keyboard selection of R609XC-1. Route R607C-1 (non-preferred) has never been accessible to the signaller via keyboard and that situation will remain. Should this functionality be required, it can be incorporated at stage 4 of this project.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</P></P>
column25:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>TL closed post commissioning ALE Stage 4</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>

<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Stage 4 (BA interlocking updated by IRL, DIS data updated by DeltaRail).</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>

The non-preferred variants of these two routes should not be accessible to the signaller via keyboard command and as such these should be removed from the specification.</FONT></FONT></P>

column11: Requested by Design - Sevonoaks Down Siding ACI Issues
column12:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: black"><FONT size=3><FONT face="Times New Roman">Trains that go into Sevenoaks siding the train number steps into R022 (5E19) as you would expect but no ACI, currently the signaller is manually inputting a train number on AD2022 (5E63)</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: black"><FONT size=3><FONT face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: black"><FONT size=3><FONT face="Times New Roman">When the time comes for the train to depart Sevenoaks siding the number steps correctly to the next berth (AD2020), then when SFK track circuit goes clear the original 5E19 gets pulled from R022 to AD2022, and then ACI works and changes the 5E19 to 5E63 but its to late as the signaller has manually done this and the train has already departed.</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>

<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt"><FONT size=3><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT color=#000000><FONT size=3></FONT></FONT></SPAN></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt"><FONT size=3><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT color=#000000><FONT size=3>The following should be added </FONT>In the i<SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri>n <FONT color=#000000>the IECC A TD link,&nbsp; RECEIVED section from IECC A.</FONT></FONT></SPAN></FONT></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt"><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT color=#000000 face=Calibri></FONT></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>

column11: Common Display Macro needs to be shown on each stepping table
column12:
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Ashford Life Extension Project - IECC A - DIS - (Note - this is a generic log for all IECC TD design)</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>The note "For details of the 'common display macro' please refer to the associated Block Schematic (xxxxxxxxxx)" on the TD stepping Tables is not acceptable. The macro table needs to be reproduced on the stepping table itself so that the tester can show discrete check marks for each test performed in accordance with the SWTH. You only need to reproduce the table as an Excel table as it is shown on the BS then the tester can extend it and add columns to write in the appropriate berth names for the display pairs and tick off each step as it is performed. It is arguable whether the Block Schematic is even acceptable as a testing document due to the insistence by designers of commoning up steps in complicated areas such that discrete check marks cannot be shown and therefore not is&nbsp;in accordance with the SWTH.</P>
column25: Situation discussed and 1st meeting held - no further action as far as this test log is concerned - test check marks will be shown on a seperate sheet for now.

column11: SIMBIDs Train Approach berth conditions in Stepping Tables
column12:
<P>Ashford Life Extension Project - IECC A </P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>TD Stepping Tables - for all SIMBIDS Train Approach berths (take STA1 as the example for the purposes of this log).</P>
<P>For each step to and STAx berth, the Conditions column has -$STA1 included but I believe it is spurious and can find no way to test it. </P>
<P>To&nbsp;load the STAx berth you need the 132B/134B/136B etc. Request button operated as either&nbsp;a trigger, or already operated as a condition. </P>
<P>However, once the Request is released, either by the passage of a&nbsp;train (it effectively TORRs the Request) or by cancellation of the Request by pulling up on the route before a train has entered it, this will Clear Out the STAx berth.</P>
<P>Therefore there should never be a situation where the STAx berth is left populated and hence does not have to be tested for in the Condition colum by including -$STA1.&nbsp;</P>
<P>However, if I'm missing a reason why it has to be included then please let me know so I can determine how to test it and tick off the&nbsp;-$STAx entry in the Conditions column of the Stepping Tables.</P>
column25: Designers comment noted - will check again at Stage 3. This log can be closed.

column11: Stepping (not) between workstations - right road and SIMBIDs
column12:
<P>Ashford Life Extension Project - IECC A - DIS 1</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>I have been running simulated trains between Sevenoaks on DIS 1 and Tonbridge on DIS 2 and there seem to be some fundamental problems with the stepping. Trains are not operating the Train Approach berths on DIS 2 and are coming across as non-described. </P>
<P>In the other direction, a SIMBIDs train was signalled and stepped through correctly from DIS2 to DIS1, but a second train signalled right road was given the same description as the first (SIMBIDs) train in the (Right Road) train approach berth on DIS 1 even though it was stepping along on DIS 2 with a different description.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Nathan suggests that this may be a combined design and data prep problem. It will need further investigation but I doi not have the time to dwell on it at this stage of the FAT.</P>
column25: <P>Trains now run sucessfully in all directions between DIS 1 &amp; DIS 2.</P>
column29:
<P>Small update to&nbsp;design for W1 to W2 fringe in UP2 so the new 'wrong-road' design is transparent to the signallers in terms of display. Will need re-testing against new design. However, this is not the cause of the fault (see below)</P>

column11: DIS 3 Appledore Branch Warning berth APW1
column12:
<P>Ashford Life Extension Project - IECC A - DIS 3</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Appledore Warning Berth&nbsp;- Lydd Branch</P>
<P>There are no notes on the TD block schematic or stepping tables (and no Alarms and Miscellaneous Spec. has been provided) to explain the purpose of Appledore Warning Berth APW1 and the associated APWX blind berth.</P>
<P>When occupied, APW1 raises an alarm on the GPVDU but there is no explanation of the conditions under which it should be raised which would be helpful when testing its operation - the testers mantra is validation and verification, has it been designed to the spec. and/or requirements and if so, does it function correctly. I can not sign for this as fully tested unless I am satisfied that these requirements have been fulfilled and therefore require more info. (generally) than is currently provided on TD documentation.</P>

column11: FETD ECS link - R162B1M sends the wrong "S" data bit
column12:
<P>Ashford Life Extension Project - IECC A</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Setting R162B1M route (via P1135 Reverse) sends the wrong "S" data message on the FETD link - SF1104 instead of SF1101.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Also applies to R164B2M and R164B2W - wrong "S" data messages generated when these routes set.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Edit 10/12/2012 - Also applies to Inter Unit Link.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Edit 22/01/13 - This route is no longer transmitted to the FETD link but is still not working correctly on the Inter Unit Link.</P>
<P>Further update - Nathan has put BR1631 on instead of Sim - route bits take quite a while to come through but do generate the correct S data message on the Inter Unit Link - therefore it looks like the problem with generating the correct message is in the simulator data when these routes are set.</P>
<P>Mike says there are notes in the I/L data to say you can't get B1M anyway, so I'm closing this log out, to be re-visited at the stage when B1M is brought into use. </P>

column11: DIS 1: V228 loading VA03 - error in the Condition line is stepping tables?
column12:
<P>Ashford Life Extension Project - IECC A - DIS 1</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Further to log 081 which was:</P>
<P>DIS 1 TD Stepping (page 12 of 14) the load of Victoria Approach berth VA03 does not work when $V228 is the trigger but does when either RV220C, RV216 or RV224 routes (via the RII) are used as Triggers.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>I now think the design may be wrong for this particular step. It is </P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>FROM:V228 TO:VA03 TRIGGER:$V228 COND: RV224. $V224 . RV220C . -$V220 . RV216B . -$V216 </P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>I think the Condition $V224 should be -$V224 to prevent the second train approaching in V228 overwriting the one already waiting in V224.</P>
column25: Mod/061 received and tested - V228 load of VA03 now working correctly.

<P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The green works in the FET3 section (address bits 10 - 1F) donΓÇÖt correctly tally with the FET3 Diffs. R2160D to R2162A iThe last line s under the 10 - 1F address bits in the diffs but address bits 20 - 2F in the spec??</SPAN></P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This has a 'knock on' effect to the rest of the document.</SPAN></P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt">also in the 20 - 2F address bit section the L***SS bits are duplicated?</SPAN></P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All the above work has been removed and is all green the only reason this log has been raised is to highlight the matter if the address bits are ever to be re-included into the FET3/D link in the future.</SPAN></P>

column12:
<P>1) Steps with the trigger as $612 are not possible because the condition L604BREQ/L606BREQ is a trigger in a later step thus creates a non described alarm.</P>
<P>2) Similarly steps with -$STA3 are&nbsp;not possible&nbsp;as, to clear STA3, requires cancelling of L604B/606BREQ which is a condition.</P>
<P>3) The use of L604/606BREQ as a trigger currently works but seems undesirable because it may not be given and if that is the case you don't want it to step.</P>
column25:
<P>1) Re-tested - OK</P>
<P>2) Removed in UR2</P>
<P>3) Agreed</P>

column11: Axle counter sections FHE and EFE
column12: Workstation 3 sets routes over these two&nbsp;axle counter sections&nbsp;so in the event of an axle counter failure, and subsequent reset, it is the workstation 3 signaller that needs to see the red background and aspect restriction of the relevant signals.&nbsp; He would also need to be the person to implement the reset of these two sections as he has control over the protecting signals.&nbsp; On the current screen design for workstations 2 and 3, currently version BH3, workstation 2 has the reset functionality of these axle counters and when these have been reset the red background is only shown on workstation 2.&nbsp; Therefore workstation 3 will have no idea that these have been reset unless he applies a reminder collar to the protecting signals, which will then show a dark red reminder device.&nbsp; Therefore a change needs to be made to the design for&nbsp;both workstations to place the reset buttons on workstation 3 instead of workstation 2.
column25: Tested all ok.

column12:
<P>Further to test log 0016,&nbsp;whilst I would agree that 705 points provide "flank" protection to the routes from 148 signal, the signalling control tables (Version CG1)&nbsp;have not called for this control to be added to either the routes from 148 signal or 705 point controls. Presumably Invensys do not wish to undertake interlocking changes of this nature in Scours Lane Relay Room and are relying on any loss of detection on 705 points dropping PS track circuit thus preventing 148 displaying a proceed aspect. </P>
<P>However, the signalling control tables do refer to the RII control tables in the "route calling" column and on reflection inclusion of 705 controls in the routes from 148 does provide additional safeguards should 705 points be inadvertantly called away from the reverse position.</P>
column25: Log in effect "withdrawn" following further consideration.

column12:
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Contingency plans corrections.&nbsp; </FONT></FONT></P><FONT face=Calibri>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3>Plan 2 is now superfluous: It is now identical to plan 1.&nbsp; There was a need for two different plans before stage F, because there was a Down Relief to Down Main crossover just west of Reading Station.&nbsp; So a Down Relief train needed to "know" whether to cross to the Main there, or at Tilehurst East.&nbsp; That crossover no longer exists, so plan 2 should be removed from the specification.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><o:p><FONT size=3>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3>Plan 5 is superfluous (and always has been).&nbsp; ARS alternative routeing will perform this function.&nbsp; When a train timetabled to use the Down Relief, strikes in on the Down Main Line, ARS will find a path segment to switch it back to the Down Relief at Ruscombe Junction.<o:p></o:p></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><o:p><FONT size=3>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3>Plan 51 is superfluous (and always has been).&nbsp; ARS alternative routeing will perform this function.&nbsp; When a train timetabled to use the Up Relief, strikes in on the Up Main Line, ARS will find a path segment to switch it back to the Up Relief at Tilehurst East Junction - EXCEPT for trains booked to switch from Up Relief to Up Main or Up West Curve at Reading West Junction, because there's no point in "weaving" them.<o:p></o:p></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><o:p><FONT size=3>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3>Plan 52 is superfluous; it is now identical to plan 51.&nbsp; There is no longer a crossover from Up Main to Up Relief at Reading station.<o:p></o:p></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph></FONT>&nbsp;</P>

column12:
<P>"Common Display Macros" have not been specified in the TD stepping tables and have not therefore been implemented in data.</P>
<P>This means that the common berths are not robust and can be manipulated to present a false display.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>e.g.&nbsp; Consider H536 &amp; H403 and common display berth X536</P>
<P>Interpose "H536" to H536 - X536 displays "H536"</P>
<P>Interpose "H403" to H403 - X536 displays "H403"</P>
<P>Cancel H403 - X536 still displays "H403"</P>
<P>Actual contents: H403,nil H536,H536.</P>
column25: Accepted.

column1: 1695 - Nat Lvl Crossing Del Tranche 11-Final Com York IECC (1)
column12:
<p>With reference to the Doncaster Panel Indication Guide produced by Babacock and issued by Richard Smith in e-mail dated 23/12/2014 (attached), the following has not been included in the data:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>1. The *1 note applicable to the signals does not use Signal OFF condition but route set and</p>
<p>2. In 7141/178 TKR(IF) the conditions relating to T6945 and T7041 clear have not been included.</p>
<p>3. For very closely following trains on the Up Main,&#160; i.e. 1st train on 6945 with 2nd on 7041, 6944/-/7041 output never clears behind first train. </p>
<p>4. If route from 932 (and 868) set for 1st train and 7141 becomes occupied, 7141/178 output becomes set after 1st train passes 932 when route TORRs (if route not set in Auto).</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Also please note Test Log 007 sent to Babcock.</p>

column1: 1695 - Nat Lvl Crossing Del Tranche 11-Final Com York IECC (1)
column12:
<p>With reference to the Doncaster Panel Indication Guide produced by Babacock and issued by Richard Smith in e-mail dated 23/12/2014&#160;the following&#160;scenario occurs:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Using Signal OFF conditions as specified means that for closely following trains on the Up Main, it is possible that a train would not show occupied on Doncaster Panel until it occupied 7041/-/158 track section i.e. 7141/178 indication would not show occupied if the required signal OFF conditions were not met.</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Is this acceptable to the Operators and how will it affect the TD stepping?</p>

column1: 1695 - Nat Lvl Crossing Del Tranche 11-Interim Com York IECC (1)
column12: <p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font color="#000000">It is with some concern that the response to Test Log 002 appears to have been dismissed without any apparent consideration of the implications of not providing Tollerton controls -&#160;the nature of the track circuit/signal control&#160;changes at the interface of the RRI/SSI&#160;in this area have resulted in significant (far from trivial) data changes and the opportunity to comply with the standard should be taken whilst both extensive RRI and SSI alterations are being undertaken. It is also felt that a test log of this nature should either be underwritten by Network RailΓÇÖs DPE&#160;or a derogation&#160;granted against the standard that was quoted in the original test log.</font></span></p>
column25: Due to &#160;the Standard Tollerton Controls&#160; NOT being implemented for this stage,&#160; and an interim measure &#160;implemented &#160;instead, Test Log 008 will be deferred to the Principal Signalling Contractors Test Log Index for closure post commissioning Stage 2B, when&#160; the Standard Tollerton Controls will be commissioned.
column29: Std Tollerton solution will be required later as this is an interim measure.

column1: 1695 - Nat Lvl Crossing Del Tranche 11-Interim Com York IECC (1)
column12:
<p>There are the following discrepancies between the TEMPLEST TFM Schematics and Temple Hirst Relay Room wiring:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>a). TFM 21 o/p 3 is named 871(B)UZPR(IF) in Schematics but simply 871(B)UZPR in the wiring diagrams.</p>

column22:
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore"><SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>IΓÇÖve discussed with Gerald.&nbsp; If the message can be output on only one workstation then it should be workstation 2 where the subarea to be turned off, RISBORO, is.&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>&nbsp;In an ideal world the message would be output on both workstations.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>

column12:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri><STRONG><U>Marbone 5:</U></STRONG> When a SPAD occurs at S393 five subareas disable. In the spec three of these have been greened out (LAVPUP ΓÇô LAYSDS ΓÇô LAYUPL). </FONT></FONT><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>HOWEVERΓÇª if an inhibit is added to signal S792 the correct subareas disable.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal></P>
column22:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>This is not a fault.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><o:p><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>When a SPAD occurs in TWT and TWS is occupied ARS canΓÇÖt tell which signal SPADed (S25 or S393) there for it turns of all ARS sub areas associated with both signals. This is why the Alarm message contains both signal names.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>When a SPAD inhibitor collar is on S393 it ignores anything to do with SPAD for this signal only so in this case it only turns off ARS areas associated with S25.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></P>

column12: The ARS spec states that when routes R671B and R673B are cancelled sub-area LPLESSEY should be turned off and that both of these routes are ARS-settable.&nbsp; In order to set these routes you need to recieve 701Y slot, which in turn sets the UP MN DN-DIR REL, but to get this slot LPLESSEY has to be switched off.&nbsp; This is mis-leading in the ARS specification and needs to be changed.
column22: <P>Existing error (in version EF4 from 2008). Out of scope of this project. No Mod sheet required.</P>

column11: R287A is listed in the ARS specification as being on Gateshead Workstation

column22: <P>Existing error (in version EF4 from 2008).&nbsp;&nbsp;Out of scope of this project.&nbsp; No&nbsp; Mod sheet required.</P>

column11: TDM Housing Alarm Fault Messages to PIT
column12:
<P>TDM housing fault cleared message on PIT has been ammended to read <STRONG>'Housing Not OK - Alarm Cleared'</STRONG>, this is confusing wording.</P>
<P>If the message is that the housing fault has cleared this should read something along the lines of&nbsp;<STRONG>'Housing OK - Alarm Cleared' </STRONG>for simplicity.</P>
<P><STRONG></STRONG>&nbsp;</P>
column22: This needs to go to the RII team
column25: Problem has been fixed by IECC Data Prep and test OK, waiting for an update of the RII configuration spec to be in line with the data.

column12:
<P>Files <STRONG>task9dat.c</STRONG> and <STRONG>task9dat.h</STRONG> have been to the FAT 1 ARS release data (RN064) when compared to site (RN061)</P>
<P>Is this correct? What is the reason?</P>
column22:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>This is correct. </FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri></FONT></FONT></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>As stated in ARS Data Prep briefing note the task9dat.c and .h are now included in the ARS data. These used to get put in&nbsp;on the build site but the new PC build needs to pick these up from the data site. These are the same as what used to be in the build site.</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri></FONT></FONT></SPAN>&nbsp;</P><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3>Files task9dat.c and task9dat.h are the <I>SPECIAL ARS data</I> to configure the Site-Specific CODE.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3>task9dat.h is just a set of "#define" statements, obtained by parsing the file "identityfile" as created by the standard ARS data compiler.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><o:p><FONT size=3>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3>task9dat.c is the data proper.&nbsp; To save it being incomprehensible sets of numbers, it uses the IDENTITIES as defined in the "#define" statements in task9dat.h.<o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><o:p></o:p></FONT></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>

column12: When at SPAD occurs at S6203 the yellow collar extends over TSAE on the detail view (VW3)
column22:
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Tahoma','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt">The reason the track TSAE appears to be highlighted in yellow when S6203 SPADs is that the TSAD*0C list on both the Views 1 &amp; 3 has been extended so that this list only covers Tracks TSAD &amp; TSAE. As both views are the same and given the proximity of Sunderland South Tunnels it is possible that this was done purposely for some unknown reason.</SPAN></P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Tahoma','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt"><?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Tahoma','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt">This change was done in release.045 on 22 Feb 2006 for Tyneside Peripheral Data Enhancements.</SPAN></P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Tahoma','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt"><o:p></o:p></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Tahoma','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 8.5pt">As this feature has existed for over 6 years it is an existing Feature.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P></P>

column12: The S2 PSU fault messages (Telegram 48)&nbsp;in the RII Config spec are not being sent to the PIT when states are changed on the S2SIM.&nbsp; All other alarms/reports work in telegram 44 work ok.
column22: Having talked to the tester who raised the log, the problem is not an RII data issue.&nbsp; It may be an IECC issue.
column25: Problem was with the S2.equ file and this has now been rectified.

column12: The earth leakage alarms have been totally removed from DIS files where as I would have expected from previous ug4 projects that these would just be altered in the gif file to 'NOISM'.&nbsp; The alarms do work on the ISM via the RII but just querying there removal from DIS.
column22: Please refer to TQ-019 - this questioned where the alarms should be seen with RII Upgrade 4 (either on the GPVDU and/or ISM).&nbsp; The response was that the earth leakage alarms&nbsp;can be routed&nbsp;directly to the ISM and didn't have to be flagged up on the GPVDU - since the alarms are seen on the ISM only this seems to be working OK.

column12: Pelaw tracks SDA SDB are not track circuit monitored but should be as they appear&nbsp;have all the conditions available in order to do so?
column22: <P>There appears no reason not to monitor these tracks now they are in front of signal 6263 (previously they were behind).&nbsp; Propose to add to changes for Change Request CR57.&nbsp; Subarea LBLDWST.</P>
column29: Updated ARS Spec version FW2 now shows tracks as monitored. Track circuits added in by data prep, APB

column12: SPAD at S1157 should only turn off LDAGDKDN according to spec but currently still turns off&nbsp;DAGDKUP which should have been removed.
column22:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Before Occupying TMSA to cause S1157 to SPAD you must put a SPAD collar on S826, otherwise as ARS canΓÇÖt tell which signal was passed at danger it will assume both of them has been passed and turn off all ARS sub-areas associated with either signal. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin"><o:p><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin">S1157 Subareas are<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN><SPAN style="COLOR: black; mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-fareast-font-family: 'MS Mincho'">LDAGDKDN</SPAN><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin">S826 Subareas are<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN><SPAN style="COLOR: black; mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-fareast-font-family: 'MS Mincho'">LDAGDKDN, LDAGDKUP<o:p></o:p></SPAN></FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin">S1165 Subareas are<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN><SPAN style="COLOR: black; mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-fareast-font-family: 'MS Mincho'">LPURFUP</SPAN><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></FONT></FONT></P>

column12: TLDK is track circuit monitored (works fine for the main route from S621) but needs logical conditions in place for routes from SS2 using ground frame 1603 as currently alarms even with SS2 routes set.
column22:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>Carl,<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><o:p><FONT color=#000000 size=1 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>I have re-run the tests of track LDK, and ARS did not generate alarms when the Ground frame was operated correctly.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><o:p><FONT color=#000000 size=1 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>The sequence of operations required is as follows:<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>1) Signaller presses "set" on 1603F indication.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>2) SIM user operates "1603 Open" MMI action.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>3) SIM user operates "1603 P(SS)3 Reverse" MMI action. &nbsp;(Wait 5 seconds)<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>4) SIM user operates either "1603 SS2 Off" or "1603 SS4 Off" action.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>5) SIM user causes track TLDK to go occupied - NO ALARM<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><o:p><FONT color=#000000 size=1 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>6) SIM user causes track TLDK to go clear - No alarm<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>7) SIM user operates either "1603 SS2 On" or "1603 SS4 On" action - must match the action chosen in operation 4.&nbsp; Wait 30 seconds.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>8) SIM user operates "1603 P(SS)3 Normal" MMI action.&nbsp; (Wait 5 seconds)<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>9) SIM user operates "1603 Close" MMI action.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>10) Signaller presses "cancel" on 1603F indication. <o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><o:p><FONT color=#000000 size=1 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>ARS data uses subroutes UGFLDKDB and UGFLDKBD for the track circuit monitoring.&nbsp; These are not displayed on the DIS.&nbsp; When the ground frame is "Open", the track is displayed in white on the DIS, but in fact the subroutes themselves only lock once the Ground Frame operator has swung the points reverse, and pressed the relevant buttons to get signals SS2 OR SS4 "off".&nbsp; The aspects of these signals are also not displayed on the DIS.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><o:p><FONT color=#000000 size=1 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>In testing this, I used the SIM "telegram display" facility.&nbsp;&nbsp; However, I have now added four new operations to the SIM data file "mmieqp.c" in directory /data4/schemes/LTSBUG4/development/SIM/sim3/mmi on Derwent; until the SIM is re-built, it will not be possible to do operations 4 and 7 in the list above (unless you use the "telegram display" facility, and modify the relevant bits in Ripple Lane input telegram 34).<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><o:p><FONT color=#000000 size=1 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>1603 is actually not a Ground "Frame" - it should be referred to as a Ground Switch Panel.&nbsp; The man in charge is pushing buttons, rather than pulling levers!<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><o:p><FONT color=#000000 size=1 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>Let me know if you need more information about this.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><o:p><FONT color=#000000 size=1 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>Regards,<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><o:p><FONT color=#000000 size=1 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT size=1><FONT size=+0><FONT color=#000000>Rowan<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
column32: re-tested with information provided. test ok

column12:
<P>The following applies to all cross boundary signals:</P>
<P>with green ghost reminder on (reminders cancelled when interlocking down) unable to set routes from that signal (as expected) but still able to set route up to that signal.&nbsp; If then apply rems again (still green ghost rems on) then unable to set route upto signal.&nbsp; </P>
<P>I would expect that whenever ghost rems on (i.e. an undefined rem state) then no routes from or to that signal should be settable.</P>
column22:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>UG4 does not fix the original problem with X-boundary reminders, it mealy indicates when and where this problem has occurred.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin"><o:p><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>With X-boundary reminders if an interlocking goes down the IECC canΓÇÖt update it of the change of status of a reminder in the adjacent interlocking if it changes. You there for get the case where one interlocking thinks the reminder is on the signal and the other interlocking thinks it has been removed.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin"><o:p><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNoSpacing><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>The Green indicators merely show when this has occurred which is why you have to set the reminder on the signal (So that both interlockingΓÇÖs think it has been set) and then cancel to remove the reminder.<o:p></o:p></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>

column22: The UG4 RII desing does not&nbsp; include a connection for the fan tray alarm as it is deemed unnecessary. On other sites, it is believed that the UG4 data does not include the RII fan tray alarm so this issue does not arise. However it would seem that York 1 RII data still includes the data for some reason. The preferred course of action is for the alarm connections to be looped out on the ISM alarm ternimal block to prevent the false indication, then, at a later date, the York 1 RII data updated to remove the alarm. There is to be no change to the hardware design as a result of this as ISM alarm connections are not shown. See also email from Gerald Brook dated 04/07/2012

<P>Stone Reminder SN192 &amp; SN178</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>If the Paddington signaller applies a reminder to SN192 (first signal on the up relief), the Acton ARS has no knowledge of this reminder and continues to request the route until the Sub-area eventually drops out. The route is NOT actually set by the interlocking, but ARS should test/check for reminders before sending a panel request. Also applicable to SN178 first signal on up main.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Pre-exitsing issue with Hayes IECC ARS.</P>

column11: Axle Counter EPR Group DIS crash potential - mitigation
column12:
<p>Reference IM026425, the gist of which was:</p>
<p><em>DeltaRail have identified an issue with Axle counter groups in that if the last axle counter in the group is occupied when the EPR is removed this will cause the DIS to crash.<br>DeltaRail have identfied an immediate action to prevent this occurring which should be passed to all signallers:<br>When Removing EPRs from an axle counter group on Edinburgh B Workstation2 please note that&#160; if the axle counter section T584 is occupied the DIS will crash when it tries to perform an autorestoration on T584. This can be avoided by individually removing the EPRs from the individual Axle Counter sections T528 and T584.</em></p>
<p>This potential risk needs to be mitigated for in Edinburgh IECC A due to the introduction of 4 new EPR Groups in Borders I/L.</p>
column25: I have followed the described procedure in the original IM for all three EPR Groups (occupying that last track circuit as shown in the .gxl file for each group)&#160;in Edin A and can't crash the workstation so this would appear to be fixed.
column29: The dummy group should have no functional impact, other than to prevent a crash.

column12:
<p>Original log 0008: The TD Block Schematic has had the generic ACI (two berth version) explanatory diagram removed on the green copy but it has not been replaced by a three berth version on the red copy. This is required for Testing purposes.</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>The response given is not satisfactory. Design do not appear to have consulted with Testing Section regarding this fundamental change to a Testing document. The re-direction to a secondary document is not applicable as far as testing marking up is concerned in accordance with the SWTH. The generic ACI diagrams need to be shown on the Block Schematic diagram as they have been up to now to satisfy testing requirements.</p>
column25: <p>Response accepted, no further action.</p>

column1: 1863 - Midcalder JCN Enhancement and Kirknewton LC - MCK
column4: Kirknewton Level Crossing (LC) & Midcalder Junction Enhancement Project
column12:
<P>Applying a reminder device to any of the Stopping/Non-Stopping selections does not prevent the opposite selection being made after the initial selection has been cancelled-off by passage of train/sub-route clearing.</P>
<P>Steps taken as follows:</P>
<P>1. Set relevant sub-route</P>
<P>2. Select (KN) STOP and correct indications obtained.</P>
<P>3. Apply reminder to (KN) STOP and correct reminder indication displayed.</P>
<P>4. Simulate passage of train/clear sub-route and (KN) STOP selection and indication cleared.</P>
<P>5. Set relevant sub-route for next train.</P>
<P>6. (KN) NSTOP can be selected.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>[This also applies when applying the reminder to&nbsp;(KN) NSTOP and the (LS) STOP/NSTOP selection]</P>
column25:
<P>Test log response reviewed and noted.</P>
<P>Signallers Briefing note to be checked when available to ensure Operators are aware of method of operation.</P>

column1: 1863 - Midcalder JCN Enhancement and Kirknewton LC - MCK
column4: Kirknewton Level Crossing (LC) & Midcalder Junction Enhancement Project
column12:
<P>A new TDM input bit to initiate Kirknewton MCB-OD, entitled "KN (UM) XS5PR, is being provided which consists of track circuits &nbsp;826(2)T, 826(3)T and 828AT. As 828AT is beyond EJ698 signal, the RII Control Table (Sheets E60/B/RI/CT/002 Sht E and E60/B/RI/CT/002 Sht 73) and data&nbsp;for the initiation of Kirknewton cannot "replicate" the MCB-OD typical circuit as shown in drawing no. X11300 version 2.0.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Is it the intention to provide a seperate TDM input for 828AT (removing this track circuit from KN (UM) XS5PR) or&nbsp;will Network Rail accept the limitations with TDM inputs as provided?</P>
column25: Test log response reviewed and comments noted.
column32: Test log response to be reviewed

<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri></FONT></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>The non-standard conditions on routes RJ720(1M) and RJ722(2M) allow these routes to set too early.&nbsp; While the train is on track T916(3), the driver cannot see repeater signal EJ722R, so ARS is setting route over Midcalder Junction some 48 seconds earlier than would be needed.</FONT></FONT></P>

column1: 1863 - Midcalder JCN Enhancement and Kirknewton LC - MCK
column4: Kirknewton Level Crossing (LC) & Midcalder Junction Enhancement Project
column12:
<P>If, as an example, a non-stopping Class 1 train strikes in on the Up Shotts, after 39 seconds the (DN)ZTAR will be&nbsp;set&nbsp;if <STRONG><EM>at that point in time</EM></STRONG> the crossing is detected down [X(DN)KR set, however, should this occur just at the moment the barriers have been called to rise, subsequent loss of the down detection results in the (DN)ZTAR becoming un-set until the "normal" time delay to initiate the (DN)ZTAR output has elapsed i.e. 68 seconds from when strike-in occurred in this example.</P>
<P>Should consideration be given to maintaining the (initial) (DN)ZTAR output should the barriers down detection be lost in these circumstances?</P>
<P>Note that the same situation occurs with the Up Midcalder Non-Stopping and Down Midcalder strike-ins.</P>
<P>This should also be discussed with Babcock/Network Rail to determine potential affects on interlocking/crossing circuitry.</P>
column25: Test log response reviewed and comments noted.

column1: 1863 - Midcalder JCN Enhancement and Kirknewton LC - MCK
column12:
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">Post Commissioning Test Log</SPAN></P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">RJ702 (1M)&nbsp;does not TORR for trains that do not stop at Kirknewton (Non stopping trains)</SPAN></P>
column25:
<P>Test log response reviewed.</P>
<P>Control table modification reviewed and format for defining change amended in conversation with designer.</P>
<P>702 TORR tested.</P>
<P>New 836 IP tested to id 50.</P>
<P>Conditions for clearance of 836T tested to track id 8.</P>
<P>It would have been possible to achieve reliable TORR by other means but this method also satisfies ARS track monitoring and does not delay rising of barriers once conditions met.</P>
column32:
<P>Review of test log response and control table mod</P>
<P>Re-test of 702 TORR</P>

column1: 1863 - Midcalder JCN Enhancement and Kirknewton LC - MCK
column12:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Post commissioning Test Log</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri></FONT></FONT></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>ARS does not correctly handle EJ702's "AUTO" button; ARS sets the "release-expected" flag for route RJ702(1M) when a train steps from berth J702 to berth J704 for ALL trains.&nbsp; ARS should only set this flag if signal EJ702's AUTO button is NOT set.</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>As a consequence, ARS will not set route from EJ704 for a second train (once a first train has passed EJ702, with signal EJ702 in automatic mode) until the second train has passed EJ702.&nbsp; This causes delay to the second train, since EJ702 will not clear to a less restrictive aspect than yellow.&nbsp; If the ?RTE button is pressed for the second train, ARS will state "Needs RJ7021M not available" - but this route is not only available, but is set, and in automatic mode.&nbsp; ARS should add RJ702(1M) to the route-set-for-train chain for the second train, and then consider setting route onwards from EJ704.</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
column25: Signal id monitored for correct registration of 702 signal set to Auto working

TQ002 was raised&nbsp;to confirm where the EJ702BR is to be displayed on&nbsp;the IECC screen, the response was to show&nbsp;the banner being on the same line as the main signal.&nbsp; NR standards states that the IECC screen should replicate&nbsp;what the scheme plan depicts and the response to TQ002 goes away from this.</P>

column4: 1883 ΓÇô Holgate & IECC2 (Leeds City) Performance Improvements
column12:
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore"><SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Section 2.9.1:</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt" class=MsoListParagraph><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>This section needs to have routes R3625EM and R3633BM. These routes have additional checks for TFFP c and TFFR c due to the fact that two trains may follow one another closely and ARS ends up requesting the route for the second train into platform 17 without having enough time to realise that the first train will be ACI-ed and needs to go out of platform 17 before the second train comes in.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
column25: Data matches mod sheet
column29: <P>ARS will correctly route the next working train out of platform 17 before setting a route for the train that follows closely into platform 17.</P>
column32: Checked in data and EFLINES.DRA file matches mod sheet

column4: 1883 ΓÇô Holgate & IECC2 (Leeds City) Performance Improvements
column11: Locations in spec but not data
column12:
<P>The following locations are in Timing and Coding Rules Spec section 3.2 but are not in ARS data:</P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">LEED421,&nbsp; LEED615,&nbsp;&nbsp; LEED694 , <SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">CRCRFTJ,&nbsp; <SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">BTLYSY</SPAN></SPAN></SPAN></P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT color=#000000>The following is also&nbsp;in ARS spec 2.3.2 &nbsp;but not in data:</FONT></SPAN></SPAN></P>

column11: Removal and Inclusion of S Class items
column12:
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #7030a0"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri><FONT color=#000000></FONT></FONT></FONT></SPAN></P><SPAN style="COLOR: #7030a0"><FONT size=3 face=Calibri><FONT color=#000000>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT face=Calibri><FONT color=#000000>It has come to the attention of this project that the following issues (all regarding S-Class items) exist in the current York IECC (1) ECS specification and IECC data:</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT color=#000000 face=Calibri>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph><FONT color=#000000><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore"><FONT face=Calibri>1)</FONT><SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN><FONT face=Calibri>Signals S1857 and GW1846 (view 4 of the South Wksn) will not send signal aspect information.&nbsp; Suggest their removal from the appropriate sections of the ECS specification and IECC data.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph><FONT color=#000000><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore"><FONT face=Calibri>2)</FONT><SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN><FONT face=Calibri>The two routes from Y947 (R947AM and R947BM) are missing .&nbsp; Suggest their inclusion into the appropriate sections of the ECS specification and IECC data.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph><FONT color=#000000><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore"><FONT face=Calibri>3)</FONT><SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN><FONT face=Calibri>The two routes from Y956 (R956AM and R956BM) are missing.&nbsp; Suggest their inclusion into the appropriate sections of the ECS specification and IECC data.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph><FONT color=#000000><FONT face=Calibri></FONT></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #7030a0"><FONT face=Calibri><FONT color=#000000>DeltaRail propose that these changes are made to the appropriate sections of the ECS specification and IECC data.</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #7030a0"><FONT color=#000000 face=Calibri></FONT></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #7030a0"><FONT color=#000000 face=Calibri>Test Log produced on the request of IECC Design</FONT></SPAN></P></FONT></SPAN>
column25: MOD sheet has been produced as well as data amendedments.&nbsp; These now test correctly.

column12: The fringe box node names have to have a suffix of "A" in data to ensure they work correctly. i.e X1AA, X4AA etc.

column12: <SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">On SDS2 in the gif file, berths F231 and F237 need changing to make then not accessible , they have been changed on DIS1 gif however these overlap onto DIS2 and have been missed. </SPAN>

column12: Design have requested that all routes from signal Y300 in YorkNTH1 SSI, should not be able to set using ARS. This requires an update to the ARS specification and would also affect SSI data designers. See attached&nbsp;TQ008 for futher information.

<p><span style="FONT-FAMILY:'Calibri','sans-serif';FONT-SIZE:11pt;"><strong>ARS SPEC VER PU1 Route</strong></span><span style="FONT-FAMILY:'Calibri','sans-serif';FONT-SIZE:11pt;"> ΓÇô Route allocation for R276ES turns off subarea LLAINDN2. The spec states only subareas LLOSDN1 &amp; LLOSUP1 should be disabled.</span></p>

column11: Log raised for Rowans Email - TTP changes
column12:
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Below is an email from Rowan Dixon. This Log has been raised to support the MOD sheet production reflecting the ammendments below.</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri></font></font>&#160;</p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>I have substantially rationalised the TTP area-specific transformations, removing many unused routines.&#160; I've tested this by preparing a timetable for today's date on a test TTP both before and after making these changes, and the timetables created are identical.</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Some changes (as listed in the attached document) are to reflect the &quot;new&quot; timing points in the ARS data.&#160; (E.g. BARKNGJ, SHBRYLJ, RPLLRRJ; &#160;which were all-trains-timed locations in the NR Timetable Planning Rules, but were being ignored by ARS.)</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Changes in the Ripple Lane area are to ensure that as many trains as possible are correctly handled (*) on both IECCs A and B.</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>(*) I.e. not only do they validate correctly, but the routes and berths on the train's path are correct, and the expected times in the berths are as correct as possible.</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Some changes are removals of routines to populate locations, codes etc that are now mandatory anyway.</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Some changes are to ensure the spec and software are identical - effectively just wording changes to remove ambiguity.&#160; Camden Road changes were done in 2013, (for IECC C North London Line) and were not correctly reflected in the NLL ARS Ops Spec.</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>Rowan</font></p>
column25: Tested ok

column12:
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Test Log raised on behalf of Rowan Dixon.</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri></font></font>&#160;</p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Consider a train in berth 0176:</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>If ARS sets FOUR routes ahead, the following aspects will be displayed:</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR176: green</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR174: double-yellow</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR170: double-yellow</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR168: yellow</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR162: red</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>If ARS sets FIVE routes ahead (i.e. R162M) the aspects seen by the train are the same, because signal UR162 is approach-controlled from red unless the onward route is set.</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>If ARS sets SIX routes ahead (i.e. R160M), the following aspects will be displayed:</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR176: green</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR174: green</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR170: green</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR168: green</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR162: double-yellow</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR160: single-yellow</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>UR156: red</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>But that then locks the Barking Tilbury Line Junction.</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Please advise how many routes ahead of a train in berth 0176 should be set?<span style="">&#160; </span>Should the train have ONE green, or FOUR?</font></font></p>
column25: Response received and noted

column11: Raised on behalf of Rowan: Items raised whilst testing
column12:
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Please find below an email from Rowan highlighting various issues he found whilst testing.</font></font></span></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri></font></font></span>&#160;</p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>In the course of the ARS testing, I identified the following DIS faults:</font></font></span></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></span></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>1) Berths R354, R592 and R596 are not keyboard-accessible on W2.&#160; This can be an operational inconvenience to the signallers.</font></font></span></p>

column11: Log raised for Elena: ARS design issues.
column12:
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Raised on behalf of Elena.</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri></font></font>&#160;</p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Non-standard route availability condition R860AW/R860BW is too restrictive, for the following reason...</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Consider the situation where two trains are crossing at Ockendon, with the down-dir train through platform 1 timetabled to arrive first.</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>The down train has route R857A, and enters platform 1 (track TEBP), and clears track TEBN</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>As soon as it does so, route R860AM and R860AW become available in the SSI.&#160; But because of the ARS approach-control condition (TEFA o), ARS does not set this route until the train reaches track TEFA.&#160; &quot;So what?&quot; - I hear you say; &quot;ARS is requesting the warner route, and the train has to be on track TEFA for 27 seconds before the signal clears.&#160; So there's no benefit in setting the route any earlier.&quot;</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>But there is.&#160; Because, as soon as route R860AW is set, ARS can then set the onward route R990AM.&#160; This allows R860AW to step-up to R860AM, and signal UR860 will clear as soon as its route-indicator conditions are satisfied - which is &quot;TEFA o or TEFB1 o&quot;.</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>This doesn't let the repeater UR860R clear to anything better than single yellow.&#160; But it does mean that the train won't slow down quite so much.</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>So I'd like to alter the non-standard conditions for R860AW/R860BW to be &quot;TEFA o or TEFB o&quot;.</font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>Rowan</font></p>
