column12:
<p>An element of the Tyne Dock Loop project has been SSI data modifications to overcome a failure that was reported through the DeltaRail Help Desk relating to an incident on 11th July 2013 and given the reference IM029966, however, despite these data alterations there is still a &quot;window of opportunity&quot;&#160;of approximately 1 second&#160;in which if 6254A(M) route is set <strong><em>just as SDB track circuit clears</em></strong> (after a train has been signalled from 5309 or 6247 signals into the Tyne Dock Arrival Line) the route sets without 2235 points being called Normal and no change of aspect on 6254 signal will occur; if ARS has set this route then the ARS Alarm &quot;6254AM Failed to Prove, LBLDEST OFF&quot; will also be received.</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Discussion with SSI AG attendee A. Dumbill has revealed that there are known&#160;timing issues&#160;within SSI when cross-boundary routes are involved if changes of state occur&#160;between the original route being requested&#160;by the entrance interlocking and the acknowledgement of route availability being reeceived back from the exit interlocking - in this case 6254A(M) entrance is in PELAWEAS interlocking and the exit signal, 6252, is in BOLDON interlocking.</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>To mitigate against this potential problem, it is proposed that a &quot;Signal Box Instruction&quot; should be issued to advise the Tyneside Signallers of this and provide advice on the action to be taken should this failure recur; the instruction would simply advise the Signaller to key 2235 points to the Normal position, noting that the &quot;Restoration Alarm&quot; for 2235 would also have been initiated at this time, and 6254 would then correctly display a proceed aspect.</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Could Network Rail please confirm that they accept that this method of mitigation is acceptable.</p>
column25: Signal Box Instructions received and comments given to Network Rail.

<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>At stage L (and prior), signal T1732 is the last signal on the Up Relief.</font></font></span></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></span></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>At stage N, the Up Relief gets renamed to the Up Reading Passenger Loop (URPL).&#160; A new line, called the Up Relief, is opened, lying south of the URPL.&#160; Signal T1732, and TIPLOC RDNG732, is the last signal on the URPL.&#160; The majority of trains will use the Up Relief.&#160; But it may be useful for regulation purposes for trains on the URPL to be held at T1732, to allow other trains on the Up Relief to overtake.&#160; That's not possible at stage L when there's only the one line.</font></font></span></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></span></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>So I think this location shouldn't be in the Stage L spec.&#160; This is why it's not in the stage L DLOC file.</font></span></p>

column1: 2300 - MPD Merchant Park Tyneside Peripheral IECC 2 - Stage 2
column12:
<p>832 Route:</p>
<p>Use of H33 or H35 being replaced in&#160;TFM 30 output bit 1 has had the unfortunate affect of any aspect level control &quot;dis-engaging&quot; the slot route.</p>
<p>Test log to be raised to Network Rail Signalling Design Group to apply a one-shot release to the route level of H33/H35 in Heighington interlocking circuitry. (Refer to test log no. 010).</p>
column25: Test log response reviewed and agree that no data changes required.

column1: 2300 - MPD Merchant Park Tyneside Peripheral IECC 2 - Stage 2
column12:
<p>832 Slot/H33 and H35 routes:</p>
<p>The use of H33 or H35 being replaced in&#160;832 slot output from the SSI has had the unfortunate affect&#160;that any aspect level control dis-engages the slot route and hence H33/H35.</p>
<p>To overcome this problem, the application of a one-shot slot-release to the route level of H33/H35 in Heighington interlocking circuitry is required such that if the Signaller at Heighington replaces the signal (either H33 or H35) before the train proceeds then he&#160;(Heighington signaller) would have to contact Tyneside Signaller to cancel and then re-send 832 slot.</p>
<p>(This is to ensure both that the correct route indications are presented to the Tynesdide Signaller and also the TD Stepping correctly takes place).</p>
column25:
<p>Test log ressponse reviewed and noted.</p>
<p>method of operation also included in Signallers Imstructions relating to the slot operation.</p>

column12:
<p>ALMOND Interlocking: Whilst testing the latch file (FLG) I noticed several spurious latches which have no function or reference on the screens.</p>
<p>Thees are.</p>
<p>1: LS(EY)654/656NL &amp; L(XB)EY654/656-R These are under the header of Route Apsect Restriction</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>2: LS(EH)637(CLAU) under the header Miscellaneous Latches however this signal is present on the screen but the latch has no function?</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>3: LS1020VFL TPWS latch.</p>

column11: ALMOND missing from AXLE counter maps
column12: <p>ALMOND isnt mentioned on any of the maps (AC01 - AC02 - SIG2) for AXLE counter purposes.</p>
In the FLG file various functions have been removed from the data but the id has not been made SPARE...this will have a major impact upon the IECC Data prep and testing.

In the IND file are the changes to the number of non-flashable&#160;identies and total number correct....changes associated with this project provide ca nmet gain of 1 whereas the number has decreased by 1.
Conflict between the data changes and TDM allocations in relation to TFM 39 i/p bit 5 - shown as SPARE in TDM Bit Allocation Sheet E60/JN/S2/D05 Version DV2 but T15 TK in data.

Conflict between the TDM Bit Allocation Sheet E60/JN/S2/D05 Version DV2 and S2 Interface Rack Sheet E60/JN/S2/E15 Version DV2 - Interface Rack Sheet shows 13 TK becoming SPARE but the Bit Allocation does not.

Within the RII data and RII Control tables, an assumption has been made on the method of operation of 405 R button and its associated indication, however, until all of the relevant Relay Room and Location wiring diagrams are provided it is not possible to determine if the method of operation of the Replacement function is correct.

column11: ARS Data does not match ARS Data Prep Manual
column12:
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri><font color="#000000">The ARS data does not match the Data Preparation Manual; the manual states</font></font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri><font color="#000000">&quot;For routes where there are alternative overlaps, the overlap which conflicts with the fewest other routes should be selected&quot;.&#160; This has not been done here.</font></font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font color="#000000" size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri>ARS had not set the route from ME178 - When the route was available.</font></font></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><font size=3><font face=Calibri></font></font></p>
column25: <p>OK</p>
column29: <p>When considering priority for trains requiring route R159CM, ARS will not consider that this route conflicts with routes over track TLD, thereby allowing a parallel move into/out of Princes Risborough platform 1.</p><p>The overlap lying over P923Reverse (TLL then TLK) now conflicts additionally with route R165AM; however, this is a very rarely-used route.&#160; This overlap also conflicts with R200BM, but R159CM conflicts with this route anyway, because R200BM's overlap requires P921 normal at the other end of Princes Risborough station.</p>

column12:
<P>Scheme Plan 08-NE-0079 Version C:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>On the Down Harrogate (in the Burley Park area) track circuits 18 and 19 have been re-named AB-1 and AB-2 respectively and are combined to be indicated on&nbsp;Leeds West IECC Workstation as AB track circuit, however, there is already an AB track circuit (albeit as part of a grouped indication) on the Up Shipley Main. These track circuits are both geographically located at the West end of the workstation's area of control and portrayed in close vicinity to one another on the IECC screen layout - view 3.</P>
<P>This contradicts the requirements for unique identification of infrastructure within a control area. (GK/RT0009).</P>

column12:
<P>Design request log:</P>
<P><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>ETCD spec has berths 0213 and 0652 in section 2.1 (berths know to IECC). It is unclear what these berths actually refer to ΓÇô it may be that 0213 has been mixed up with S213 (Yoker fringe ΓÇô first berth belonging to Yoker when leaving IECC D) and that 0652 has been left in when the Down Refuge sidings were altered to have F/R/A/B652 berths.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Cowlairs CEG data has previously been released to FAT with the interlink data written as two separate rem files (both with area name CEG1).</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>The CEG Spec currently has just one section (8) for the interlinks which implies there should be only 1 rem file (a dual link).</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>It is preferable to use two rem files (see discussion below).</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3 face=Calibri></FONT></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Therefore a mod will be required to split the interlinks into 2 separate sections and to specify the name of the 2<SUP>nd</SUP> link.</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: #1f497d"><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Data (for FAT3) has been amended in advance of the MOD, to define the area name of the 2<SUP>nd</SUP> link as ΓÇ£CEG2ΓÇ¥.</FONT></FONT></SPAN></P>

column12: Axle counter indications across duplicated workstations do not appear to be consistent.&nbsp; Upon a thourough investigation&nbsp;of the reset process of axle counters I have noticed a few indication discrepancies.&nbsp; If an axle counter is reset on the primary workstation it shows the correct indications but it shows spurious indications on the secondary workstation and vise versa.&nbsp; I have attached a table of all the tests I have been through and the indications that were shown on both workstations.

Correlation of screen views has shown that there are a number of TPWS fitments where "blue text" has been provided for the signal id but the existing faceplate diagram does not show the relevant signal as being fitted, however, photographic evidence does indicate that "TPWS" stickers are fitted on the panel and the scheme plan supports the fitment of TPWS equipment. The list below details the affected fitments.</P>
<P></P>

<P>&nbsp;</P>

The panel photos shows a sticker by the point key stating "737 points removed" and a sticker by the pointwork with illegible text;&nbsp;the scheme plan does not show the fixed diamonds and 737 points do not exist in CLAIRS SSI data.</P>

column12:
<P>Detailed Screen view 3:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>It is noted that the TPWS fitment on signal CE480 has a seperate TPWS fault reporting indication whereas all other TPWS fault reporting is achieved via the red aspect. Has either a risk assessment being undertaken or derogation against NR/SP/SIG/10133 Section 7.1 (Indication Requirements) being applied for to perpetuate the mixing of fault reporting methods on the same workstation ?</P>
column25:
<P>Derogation, test log and e-mail responses reviewed.</P>
<P>It is noted that the derogation does not specifically refer to NR/SP/SIG/10133 Section 7.1 (Indication Requirements) but the e-mail correspondence illustrates that the Network Rail DPE accepts that the mixing of TPWS fault-reporting methods will be perpetuated.</P>
column32: Review of derogation, test log&nbsp;and e-mail responses.

column12:
<p>log created on request from Kamlesh Limbachia.</p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Nick</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Great.&#160; Will liaise with Kam and get on with it.&#160; (Yeah, I canΓÇÖt think of anyone else to confirm it besides Mike Christelow.)</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Note it will not be strictly to Option 1 in every minute detail, but along similar lines to it.&#160; Summary of what TQ would probably have stated:</font></font></span></p>
<p style="TEXT-INDENT:-18pt;MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt;" class=MsoListParagraph><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><span style=""><font size=3 face=Calibri>a)</font><span style="FONT:7pt 'Times New Roman';">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>2 blind copy berths will be created; KELV and AARR.&#160; Both will be sent to SMART.</font></font></span></p>
<p style="TEXT-INDENT:-18pt;MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt;" class=MsoListParagraph><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><span style=""><font size=3 face=Calibri>b)</font><span style="FONT:7pt 'Times New Roman';">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>When train steps from 0313 to R480, its description is copied into KELV (but not when ARS subsequently interposes into R480).</font></font></span></p>
<p style="TEXT-INDENT:-18pt;MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt;" class=MsoListParagraph><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><span style=""><font size=3 face=Calibri>c)</font><span style="FONT:7pt 'Times New Roman';">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>When train clears T2756 moving onto T2758, KELV steps into AARR.&#160; (So AARR can be used by TRUST to announce arrival of train at Anniesland.)</font></font></span></p>
<p style="TEXT-INDENT:-18pt;MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt;" class=MsoListParagraph><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><span style=""><font size=3 face=Calibri>d)</font><span style="FONT:7pt 'Times New Roman';">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </span></span></span><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>When R480 clears, AARR clears.</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Thanks and regards</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Niz</font></font></span></p>

column12: The site name shown at the top of the TI screen is ambiguous unless there is only one Scalable Installation at a given site.&#160; When there are more than one, as there will be as of Christmas 2013, it will be quite difficult for the Technicians to find the correct TI screen for the correct IECC to try and diagnose any issues that have arisen.&#160; Once TVSC is fully populated with Scalable Installations there could be up to a total of 12 TI screens which is going to make it even more difficult for the Technicians.&#160; Consider changing this for all Scalable sites that have more than one IECC Scalable Installation to make it IECC specific rather than location and IECC number.

column12:
<p>Panel request for QR148D(M) and QR148D(C) is a combined identity, QR148D(M/C),&#160;in the route requests but in the ARS route requests this identity is only QAR148D(M).&#160; The ARS spec states that both of these routes should be ARS settable but without the combined identity this will not be the case.</p>

column12: <p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>The route entrance character for signal SN164 on Workstation 2 view 2 is in the wrong place.&#160; It is possible to cause a track circuit element to display red when there's no train nearby.</font></font></span></p>

column12:
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>All the steps past PE02's automatic signals only work, on average, 50% of the time.</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>This is because the step is triggered by the track circuit going occupied, but has a condition that the signal is &quot;off&quot;.&#160; The track circuit going occupied causes the signal to revert to danger.&#160; So if the workstation &quot;sees&quot; the signal at red first, then it won't perform the TD step.</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3 face=Calibri>&#160;</font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>Affected signals in PE02 are:</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>135</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>151</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>159</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>173</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>178</font></font></span></p>
<p style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;" class=MsoNormal><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"><font size=3><font face=Calibri>160</font></font></span></p>
column25: This has been tested on site, no issues found

column12: <p>When running ARS to timetable, approach berths between workstations display pink and only turn blue on stepping into first berth past approach.</p>
column25: Data diffs checked ok for changes but as response states problem still persists.&#160; Suggest Signaller's Instruction provided
column29:
<p>Data prep bench-check found 3 (APDL, APDM, APDR) approach berths on SDS1 of imaginary type. These have been changed to approach type.</p>
<p>Files pe021.dsb, pe131.dsb, SDS1/gif have been amended SA 17/12/13</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Data changes have insured consistency of approach, however, these will not stop the approach berths being pink. This situation&#160;cannot be avoided as&#160;ARS only sends a colour change message (from default of pink) on train initialisation i.e. at the edge of the area. The workstation boundary between Paddington and Acton is internal to the ARS control area and the trains are therefore not being initialised - rather ARS sees this as one continuous area and doesn't know about the approach stepping, If we were to include the approach steps in ARS this would introduce significant problems and is not, therefore, an option. MH 19/12/13</p>

column12:
<p>At request of Tony Terry, test log raised to allow production of modification to resolve the following:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font color="#000000"><font face=Calibri><font size=3><em>There appears to be an omission from the TTP Specification for Reading B. I have created the TTP data exactly corresponding to the specification however I have just checked the prepared timetables against the TTP validation software and all of the 5K** trains that start and end&#160; at Bedwyn and reverse at the Bedwyn Reversing Siding &#160;are showing as invalid.</em></font></font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font color="#000000" size=3 face=Calibri><em>&#160;</em></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font color="#000000"><font face=Calibri><font size=3><em>I checked the existing TTP area specific transformation software for the Classic IECC Reading TTP on CVS &#160;(covering A and B), and there is a rule for Bedwyn as follows:</em></font></font></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><font color="#000000" size=3 face=Calibri><em>&#160;</em></font></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="FONT-FAMILY:&quot;Courier New&quot;;COLOR:black;"><font size=3><em>Insert path code DW if train starts at Bedwyn and next location is Bedwyn Reversing Siding</em></font></span></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><span style="FONT-FAMILY:&quot;Courier New&quot;;COLOR:black;"><font size=3><em>&#160;</em></font></span></p>
<p class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN:0cm 0cm 0pt;"><em><font color="#000000" size=3 face=Calibri>However it looks like this was never documented in the existing Reading B ARS Specification, so was not included in the new Reading B TTP Specification; and hence did not end up in the current TTP release. So to fix this I will need to produce a new release of TTP and we should update the TTP Specification accordingly.</font></em></p>
column25: MOD sheet 006 has been produced and tests OK

column12: If both modem links to the field end are up and working and the A side of RII is at Master, B side at Standby, the A interlocking box will show green and the B box will be red.&#160; Once logged in to the TI you can then use a show command on the RII which will show both field ends as being OK.&#160; If the RII is changed over the display on the interlocking boxes will show the A side red and the B side green, so this would suggest that the interlocking boxes are only displaying which RII computer unit is at master and not the state of the interlocking communications.&#160; After numerous discussions with the Development team this has still not been rectified.
column25: Information now incorporated into Technicians Briefing Note.

column12:
<p>Didcot Workstation 1 Overview 2 and Superview 4:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Existing deficiency in that portrayal of the platforms at Pangbourne incorrectly show platform face for&#160;the Up Main. (Detail view correctly portrays this).</p>

Following the&#160;RSAR Stage L Commissioning, the Didcot IECC Signaller was unable to make non-ARS trains run to Special Timing Patterns and a &quot;patch&quot; was applied to TTP overcome the problem; this needs to be incorporated within the RSAR Stage N TTP data build.

<p>WKS1:There are two ARS sub areas that do not show reminders, <span style="FONT-SIZE:11pt;FONT-FAMILY:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;"><font color="#000000">LTUM and LTDM</font><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"> .</span></span></p>

<p><span style="FONT-SIZE:11pt;FONT-FAMILY:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;"><span style="COLOR:#1f497d;"></span></span>&#160;</p>
WKstation 1,&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Routes 1754A(C), R1754B(M) and R1754B(C) are giving back spare code &#160;messages when these routes are set on BR1631
<p>WKstation 2,subroute ULBZ-AB and ULBZ-BA shows CtoA&#160;and AtoC when triggered using br1631</p>

<p>WKstation 1, When setting rem or iso for S1761 cross screen button using br1631 ( LTRD or LTRDE 1761W(x) )&#160;&#160; the reminder is not being displayed . BUT the reminder is being displayed when using the trackerball when still conected to the interlocking in br1631 . </p>
<p>WKstation 1, When setting rem or iso for S1742 using BR1631 no code is being set back .</p>

<span style="FONT-SIZE:11pt;FONT-FAMILY:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;"><font color="#000000">It appears as if no cable has been allocated for SVDU1 on Workstation 7 (Reading West Workstation). (Drawings S7166-TVSC03-HC-FCS-2202/1 &#160;and /3 refer).</font></span>

<p>Detail View&#160;5:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Orientation of IBJ between ENR/FMJ should be positioned&#160;(relatively speaking) to the left of FMJ/FML IBJ.</p>

<p>Overview 2, Detail View&#160;5 and Superview 10:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Platform 2 at Twyford is not the same length as Platform 3 giving the impression that the position of&#160;the IBJ between EHL/EHP is in the wromng position (relative to the end of Platform 2).</p>

<p>Overview 2, Superviews 9 and 10:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>&quot;Down Branch Up&quot; text and direction arrows for the Henley Branch disjointed.</p>

<p>Overview 2, Detail View 6 and Superview 10:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>a) Replacements have not been provided on signals 1610 and 1612 as required by Scheme Plan note.</p>
<p>b) Limits of track circuit indications on the Down Main and Down Relief are not defined on the relevant Scheme Plans, how have the limits being determined?</p>
column14: Scheme Plan 11-GW-017/02 Version C, 11-GW-015-10 Version A1

column12:
<p>Detail View&#160;5:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>a) Name for Twyford Station is positioned in between the Up and Down Main...this would be better positioned above the &quot;platforms&quot;.</p>
<p>b) It is a shame that the opportunity has not been taken to &quot;space-out&quot; the infrastructure on the Henley Branch...it is now very cramped at the Twyford station end.</p>
<p>c) On the Henley Branch, Bolney UWC is actually called &quot;Bolney Farm&quot; in the Sectional Appendix.</p>
<p>d) Has agreement been obtained with Network Rail for not providing an &quot;R&quot; suffix on 1634 distant signal?</p>

<p>Detail View&#160;6:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Positioning of 1626 does not reflect the fact that this signal is mounted on the same structure as signals 1629/1631.</p>

<p>Detail View 5:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>a) There&#160;are no PSR TPWS OSS loops on the Up Main as shown by the &quot;P&quot; within ERW axle counter section.</p>
<p>b) There appears to be no directional indication that a &quot;wrong-direction&quot; move is being made from 1761/1763 signals up to 1771/1779 signals.</p>
<p>c) Scours Lane Junction does not now exist...if this is to be identified on the screens it should be as Whitehouse Junction.</p>
<p>d) Orientation of IBJ FTD/FTE on Down Relief should&#160;be placed&#160;&quot;country-side&quot; of FPG/FPH IBJ (on Up Reading Passenger Loop).</p>

<p>Overview 2 and Superview 3:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Foul&quot; axle counter at Reading West Junction shown against wrong axle counter section. (Correct on Detail View 6).</p>

<p>Overview 2:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>a) Distant signal 1759 on the Down Relief has two red aspects.</p>
<p>b) Inconsistancy in provision of showing the &quot;next&quot; signal number on the boundary to Workstation 2 - only provided on the &quot;Main&quot; lines.</p>
<p>c)&#160;Provision of inter-workstation cut-lines and&#160;nomenclature&#160;does not match up with those on Workstation 2 Overview 1.</p>

<p>Workstation 1 Detail View 6/Workstation 2 Detail View 3:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Inconsistancy in provision of axle counter reset on FPW at workstation boundary - it appears as if (generally) the last axle counter in the &quot;normal&quot; direction of travel on a workstation controls the reset.</p>

<p>Detail View 7:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>No overlap symbol provided for Up direction moves at FRL/FRE IBJ.</p>

<p>Overwiew 1, Detail View 3 and Superview 5:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>IBJ between FRB/FRC should be position at foot of 1782/2805 BRs.</p>

<p>Many of the signals on Workstation 3 are not displaying the red aspect restriction reminder. Of those tested, S1669 and S1625 displayed it correctly, S1667, S1636, S1632, S1642, S1630, S1637, S1635 and S1667 display a Cyan REM when applied but not the Red Aspect Restriction, and S1644, S1653, S1657, S1646, S1655, S1627 and S1626 can not be tested due to white route lights being erroneously displayed by the simulator, preventing the appropriate routes from being set.&#160;</p>
<p>WKstation 1 axle counters are being effected by Workstation 2. Please see Emails for details of faults.</p>
<p>WKstation 1 ACO1 axle counter map . Should be showing TFVK but shows TPVK.</p>
<p>WKstation 1, Unable to remove EPR from Axle counter TEPE,TEPC,TEPD,TEPF</p>

<p>Overview 1, Detail View 3 and Superview 1:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>SB903 overlap track circuit WB not indicated as required by Scheme Plan.</p>

<p>Basildon HABD:</p>
<p>&#160;</p>
<p>Overview 1 and Superview 2: Up Main HABD shown on wrong side of ERM/ERN IBJ.</p>

column12:
<p>With reference to TQ012 and the lack of information on the Stoke Mandeville to Great Missenden section, the review has been undertaken against an eB copy of the Aylesbury to Great Missenden Location Area Plan, Drawing no: S3610/27/8 Sheet 2 Version GA1 and the following items noted:</p>
<p>a) Orientation of UT/UU IBJ in-line with 376 signal is incorrect.</p>
<p>b) The relationship of the platforms at Great Missenden with UT/US track circuits and 776 shunt signal is incorrect.</p>
<p>c) VG track circuit is not long enough - the IBJ with (JW)BA/BB/BC/BD track circuits should fall opposite UN track circuit.</p>
<p>d) The &quot;final IBJs&quot; to the adjacent fringe on the Up and Down lines do not line up as depicted.</p>

column11: Principles review of LSV against Signalling and Scheme Plans
column12: <p>Whilst it is recognised that TQ012 relating&#160;to the lack of information on the Stoke Mandeville to Great Missenden section of Signalling Plan S3610/2/8 Version GA1 has been raised to the project,&#160;it is felt that it is sensible to include this item as a Test Log so that the issue does not become overlooked as this section of the Screen Views cannot currently be verified for accuracy against the existing Signalling Plan.</p>

column12: If a TD is in berth 8114 and then the axle counter for AVY is reset the description doesn't display correctly
column22: <P>8114 is on ADC not AVY.&nbsp; ADC has two berths (the other is 8129).&nbsp; There is a known&nbsp;code fault which means that if any reminder is shown on a track (ENG and/or TI&nbsp;or as you have reported in this case any of the axle counter&nbsp;reminders) and a TD is cleared from one of the two berths, both berths are overwritten with the reminder colour or colours.&nbsp; This code fault has been previously reported in relation to&nbsp;cyan&nbsp;ENG reminders on UR-2090 (for&nbsp;Shenfield).</P>
column25: As this is a known code fault it will not be rectified for this project.

column12: Under normal train movement, a TD in berth A808 will not step into LSCE until A808 clears out.&nbsp; There is no step for this included in the steppin data so the signaller will have to cancel every TD out of A808 for this step to happen.&nbsp; This needs a clear out step adding for when TUL/UN becomes clear.
column22: Step out of A808 is done by adjacent TD (Cambridge TD); sent to IECC via ECS to be effected in IECC also.&nbsp; This is the meaning of the dotted step arrow out of A808.&nbsp; Therefore no need for clearout step in IECC stepping table or data.&nbsp; No change proposed.

column12:
<P>Further to test log 105, is there not a risk that if 13 T3PR failed to pick, premature release of 24 ALSR (24 "backlock") could occur resulting in loss of route holding?</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>It is recognised that Harrogate SB Diagram Indication for 13T has to be fed from the last TPR and that there is a risk that there could be a discrepancy between what is shown on the Workstation and Diagram.</P>
column25: Modification reviewed
column29: Wiring alterations in Harrogate SB and 20/19 REB. No data change required. Andrew Mulliss. Amey CRE/RDE. 5/10/12

column1: HarrogateAreaSigRenewals (IECC Harrogate Scalable and SSI) Ix1
column3: IECC Harrogate Scalable & HARRGATE01 SSI /  Harrogate SB
column12:
<P>Further to the response to test logs 86 item c. and&nbsp;109 (TQ175), please note the following concerns:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<OL>
<LI>Test log 86 item c. response indicated that mitigation was required - this appears to have been contradicted by the response to Test log 109.</LI>
<LI>NR/L2/SIG/30009/E610 Section 5.3 states that "<I><FONT size=2 face=Arial><FONT size=2 face=Arial>This is the preferred method for signalling controlled from a VDU based system."</I></FONT></FONT><B><FONT size=1 face=Arial><FONT size=1 face=Arial></LI></B></FONT></FONT>
<LI>If other (technical) solutions are possible, it would&nbsp;appear&nbsp;to be unnecessary to place the onus on the Signaller to follow procedures. Has this option considered possible Signaller distractions i.e.&nbsp;either required to deal with an issue on the lever frame&nbsp;or, in the future, when Harrogate SSI has been re-controlled from another Control Centre and this site is potentially a small part of another workstation.</LI>
<LI>No mention has been made about the use of the Turnback Siding by "yellow" plant that is&nbsp;entering/leaving the Down Siding.</LI>
<LI>Derogation against GC/RT5021 is reliant on provision of the de-railer (5173) to protect the Down Siding but if that protection is degraded does this imping upon that derogation in any way?</LI>
<LI>No risk assessments during the GRIP 1 to 4 process appear to have considered the trapping arrangements/requirements fior 5172 points.</LI></OL>
column25: Test log response reviewed and noted.
column42: Raising of concerns to Network Rail

column1: HarrogateAreaSigRenewals (IECC Harrogate Scalable and SSI) Ix1
column3: IECC Harrogate Scalable & HARRGATE01 SSI /  Harrogate SB
column11: SA Track Circuit: Provision of Stainless Steel Streep
column12:
<P>At an earlier stage in the project, the provision of stainless steel strip on SA Track Circuit over 5172B points and 5173 de-railer was discussed as a mitigation against not detecting trains entering or leaving the Down Siding as the siding is infrequently used and re-issue of the Scheme Plan to Version D has not indicated that this is to be provided.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Could confirmation be given that stainless stell strip will be provided as described above.</P>
column25: Test log response reviewed and noted.

<P>Monitoring of the signal memories indicates the following:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>a). Green aspect not displayed when the HGPR and DGPR are both&nbsp;input (both will be energised on site for signal to display green aspect).</P>
<P>b) The RGPR needs to be positively proved in the "Replaced" indication.</P>
<P>c). On the IECC work station&nbsp;the "Replaced" indication is driven from the signal memory bit 6, however, the incoming YZPR function does not affect the state of this bit.</P>
<P>d) Suspect that the YZPR function will be input into SSI when YPR relay down-proved i.e. when YPR not output, YZPR will be input providing YPR relay drops.</P>

column1: HarrogateAreaSigRenewals (IECC Harrogate Scalable and SSI) Ix1
column3: IECC Harrogate Scalable & HARRGATE01 SSI /  Harrogate SB
column12:
<P>With reference to e-mail from Andy Dumbill dated 31/08/2012 and SSIAG meeting, testing of Rigton Level Crossing Strike-In data and considering implications of treadle failure/s has revealed the following:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>1. "Stopping" selected:</P>
<P>a) Q1 and Q2 treadles both fail to detect passage of a train-TAR initiated when berth track circuit of signal protecting crossing occupied<EM> i.e. crossing initiation operated later than should be the case.</EM></P>
<P>b)&nbsp; Q1 treadle fails to detect passage of a train-TAR initiated when treadle Q2 detects passage of train<EM> i.e TAR initiated at correct point.</EM></P>
<P>c)&nbsp; Q2 treadle fails to detect passage of a train-TAR initiated when berth track circuit of signal protecting crossing occupied<EM> i.e. crossing initiation operated later than should be the case.</EM></P>
<P>d)&nbsp; Q1 and Q2 treadles both continuously "detect" the prescence of&nbsp;a train-TAR initiated when&nbsp;strike-in track circuit&nbsp;occupied<EM> i.e. crossing initiation operated sooner than should be the case.</EM></P>
<P>e)&nbsp;Q1 treadle continuously "detects" the prescence of a train-TAR initiated when treadle Q2 detects passage of train<EM> i.e TAR initiated at correct point.</EM></P>
<P>f) Q2 treadle continuously "detects" the prescence of a train - TAR initiated when strike-in track circuit occupied<EM> i.e. crossing initiation operated sooner than should be the case.</EM></P>
<P><EM></EM>&nbsp;</P>
<P>2. "Non-Stopping selected:</P>
<P>a) Q1 and Q2 treadles both fail to detect passage of a train-TAR initiated when berth track circuit of signal protecting crossing occupied<EM> i.e. crossing initiation operated later than should be the case AND Non-Stopping selection retained.</EM></P>
<P>b) Q1 treadle fails to detect passage of a train-TAR initiated when treadle Q2 detects passage of train<EM> i.e TAR initiated at correct point.</EM></P>
<P>c) Q2 treadle fails to detect passage of a train-TAR initiated when treadle Q1 detects passage of train<EM> i.e TAR initiated at correct point&nbsp;BUT Non-Stopping selection retained.</EM></P>
<P>d) Q1 and Q2 treadles both continuously "detect" the prescence of a train-TAR initiated when strike-in track circuit occupied<EM> i.e. crossing initiation operated sooner than should be the case.</EM></P>
<P>e) Q1 treadle continuously "detects" the prescence of a train-TAR initiated when strike-in track circuit occupied<EM> i.e. crossing initiation operated sooner than should be the case.</EM></P>
<P>f) Q2 treadle continuously "detects" the prescence of a train - TAR initiated when strike-in track circuit occupied<EM> i.e. crossing initiation operated sooner than should be the case.</EM></P>
<P><EM></EM>&nbsp;</P>
<P>The above assumes that the data is written such that the TFM input is normally made when no train is present and is lost with the passage of a train.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>The data/DIS paper needs to be reviewed - certainly the retention of the "Non-Stopping" selection under certain circumstances will also have the effect of causing TAR initiation sooner than should be the case.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>The issue of treadle failure&nbsp;mode, as&nbsp;suggested by SSIAG,&nbsp;should be discussed with Network Rail.</P>
column25: Test log response reviewed, considered and noted

<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>DRN No. 100675/DRN/Amey/047/01a requires the following changes to be made to the Harrogate IECC screen designs:</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt" class=MsoNormal><FONT size=3 face=Calibri></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l1 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore"><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>1.</FONT><SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Permanent display of the letter ΓÇÿRΓÇÖ (in grey) adjacent to the signal aspect on all distant signals (logs 7a and 11a).</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l1 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore"><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>2.</FONT><SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>Removal of the POL text (log 8a)</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0cm 0cm 0pt 36pt; mso-list: l1 level1 lfo1" class=MsoListParagraph><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore"><FONT size=3 face=Calibri>3.</FONT><SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN></SPAN><FONT size=3><FONT face=Calibri>All platforms currently identified as UP and DOWN are to be identified as 1 on the UP line and 2 on the DOWN line (log 13a).</FONT></FONT></P>

column1: HarrogateAreaSigRenewals (IECC Harrogate Scalable and SSI) Ix1
column3: IECC Harrogate Scalable & HARRGATE01 SSI /  Harrogate SB
column12:
<P>There are a number of issues with the restoration alarms and controls that have been provided on 5172 and 5173 points:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>a). The Restoration Alarm&nbsp; for 5173 is still initiated even if the Signaller has not cancelled route over points - 4112A(S) and 4114C(S) are not provided with TORR. This is a conflict between&nbsp;<SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"> NR/L2/SIG/30009/E610 Section 5.1c and SSI8003-66. </SPAN></P>
<P>b). The Restoration Alarm is&nbsp;initiated if 5173 are reverse with the key centre after either 4114A(M) or 4114B(S) used - this condition is not in the control tables but is an inherent effect as a&nbsp;result of the layout here and the data constructs as required by 8003-66 where initiation of the alarm is based on SA track circuit&nbsp;occupied and then cleared.</P>
<P>c). If a route is set from either 4112 or 4114 and then cancelled, with the train not traversing the route, no Restoration Alarm is generated on either 5172 - when 4114A(M) or 4114B(S) used, or 5173 - when 4114C(S) used.&nbsp; i.e, this could result in no trapping protection existing for either the running lines or Down Siding, even though there is a train still in the Turnback Siding, if the Signaller subsequently forgets to restore the points.</P>
<P>d). The Scheme Plan (sheet 1 of 2)&nbsp;refers to the use of "<EM>SB Track...for...Restoration of Derailer...</EM>" but there are no controls provided for this in the AFC control tables.</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Could Network Rail confirm&nbsp;if this how the Restoration Alarms for 5172/5173 and operation of 5173 derailer&nbsp;are expected to operate and advise on the conflict in standards.</P>
column25:
<P>a) Noted and response accepted.</P>
<P>b) Noted.</P>
<P>c) Further test log to Amey required.</P>
<P>d) Noted and response accepted.</P>

column12:
<P>Control Table queries/errors that will not affect data:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>a). Sheet 01L3Z-F0-011: Exit button should read LH4111W. [Seperate button needs to be defined for Reminder application/Override].</P>
<P>b).&nbsp; Sheet 01L3Z-F0-023: In "Lookback Succeeds To" column, BC is an axle counter.</P>
<P>c). Sheets 01L3Z-F0-024: in title block, even though signal is single-button control, it should still list the exit signal.</P>
<P>d).&nbsp; Sheets 01L3Z-F0-033 to 037: question use of text relating to "2 of 5, 3 of 5 etc." as therse are now individually numbered.</P>
<P>e).&nbsp; Sheet 01L3Z-F0-039: in "Section in Rear or Sub Routes Free" column, UNJ(X)-BA does not exist...should be UNJ(X)-AB.</P>
<P>f).&nbsp; Sheet 01L3Z-F0-046: functional end of 5173 should read "Single".</P>
<P>g).&nbsp;Sheets 01L3Z-F0-051 &amp;52: term used for alarm should be "Restoration".</P>
<P>h). Sheet F0-013 should have OSS+ not OSS.</P>
<P>i).&nbsp; Sheet F0-020 in tracks clear box should be (AR, AP) $40.</P>
column25: Control tables amended.

<P>DWS Screen Issues:</P>
<P>a) Orientation of SIG &amp; TRACK Screens does not correlate with Scheme Plan and&nbsp;Sub-Route/Sub-Route Overlap numbering convention.</P>
<P>b) SIG/TRACK Screens define incorrect CISR.</P>
<P>c) TRACK Screen -&nbsp;normal and reverse positions of 5173 derailer defined incorrectly.</P>
<P>d) SIG Screen - there is an AWS magnet shown at S4107.</P>
<P>e) SIG Screen - ARS Sub-Area Information superfluous.</P>
<P>f) SIG Screen - signals 3888, 4103, 4105 and 4107 do not need a "yellow" aspect displayed.</P>
<P>g) TRACK Screen - inconsistent representation of "L" signals: some show the actual number of aspects (3879, 3882) others don't (3886, 3888).</P>
<P>h) TRACK Screen - 3886 is pre-fixed "SL", all other signals simply "S".</P>
<P>i) TRACK Screen - superfluous "3" adjacent to 4111 signal.</P>
<P>j) SIG Screen - notation of H64/H65 signals inconsistent [S(H)64 and SH65]</P>
<P>k) SIG Screen - no RD feature provided for 4108 Replacement.</P>
<P>l) SIG Screen - "Removal Initiated Roundel" does not flash.</P>
<P>m) SIG Screen - "TPWS Test" feature superfluous.</P>
<P>n) SIG Screen - 4130 only needs an "Entrance" Button.</P>

<P>Further items raised.</P>

column3: IECC Harrogate Scalable & HARRGATE01 SSI /  Harrogate SB
column12:
<P>Scheme Plan 08-NE-0079:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Could Network Rail please clarify the type of crossing that New York Farm is: the Sectional Appendix (Sheet LN838 Seq. 002 dated 02/12/06), ORS (Doc. Ref. NR/STPE/ORS/106675) and Form A Civils Drawing BA60219-DRG-BAI0049 define the crossing as a "UWC" whereas the Scheme Plan and FPS (Doc. Ref. SDG\FPS\106675\GS4\1 Issue 2) define it as a "Bridleway".</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Please also note that if the crossing is deemed to be a "Bridleway", then there is no requirement for signal L4134 to be&nbsp;single-button controlled. (NR/L2/SIG/11201-Mod B7 Section 3.2.3aii defines these requirements).</P>
column25: Test log response noted.

<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT size=2 face="Segoe UI">a) Should SB track circuit be used in Approach Locking Release conditions...this is not one of the items listed on Scheme Plan note *6?</FONT></SPAN></P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT size=2 face="Segoe UI"></FONT></SPAN>&nbsp;</P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT size=2 face="Segoe UI"></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman','serif'; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><FONT size=2 face="Segoe UI">b) In addition, if Engineering trains do split or are stabled in the Turnback Siding i.e.&nbsp;Tampers etc., the&nbsp;approach locking would then always release after the relevant time delay.&nbsp;</FONT></SPAN></P>
column25:

column1: HarrogateAreaSigRenewals (IECC Harrogate Scalable and SSI) Ix1
column3: IECC Harrogate Scalable & HARRGATE01 SSI /  Harrogate SB
column12:
<P>Harrogate Control Table Sheet 01L3Z-F0-030:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Automatic signals LH4103, LH4105 and LH4107 do not have the following track circuits in their controls:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>LH4103 - AB-2,</P>
<P>LH4105 - AD-2 and</P>
<P>LH4107 - AG-3</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>as required by GK/RT0060 Appendix 2 Table 4 Ref 2.&nbsp;</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>It is also noted that these overlap track sections were previously provided in the controls of these signals and the other Automatic signals in this relay-controlled area, L3879, L3884, L3886 and L3888, still have their overlap track sections controlling the relevant signal.</P>

column12:
<P>Harrogate Control Table Sheets 01L3Z-F0-048 &amp; 049:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>#1 and #2 controls not required...this column is for use where there are&nbsp;(stop)&nbsp;signals between the strike-in point and the crossing which would not initiate the auto-lowering/picture calling if these signals were "ON".&nbsp; DIS145 and typical crossing circuit sheet X71360 reinforces this principle.</P>
column25: <P>Control tables annotated.</P>

column1: HarrogateAreaSigRenewals (IECC Harrogate Scalable and SSI) Ix1
column3: IECC Harrogate Scalable & HARRGATE01 SSI /  Harrogate SB
column12:
<P>Harrogate TFM Schematic:</P>
<P>&nbsp;</P>
<P>It is noted that&nbsp;in Version AT2 of the Harrogate TFM Schematics the input for PSR 332 VCR has been removed (previously provided in&nbsp;version AT1), presumably on the basis that NR/SP/SIG/10133 Section 5.2d) and Section 19.2 apply, however, this does not then meet the requirements of Section 7.1 paragraph 2 ("...<FONT face=GillSans>re-signalling and retro-fitment TPWS failure reporting methods shall not be inter-mixed on the same section of a signalling panel or SignallerΓÇÖs workstation") and there is no statement regarding TPWS fault reporting either on the Scheme Plan or in the FPS as required by paragraph 3.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT face=GillSans></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P><FONT face=GillSans>Could you please advise how this apparent conflict is to be resolved.</P></FONT>
column25: Test log response noted and accepted.

column12: <SPAN style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial','sans-serif'; COLOR: black; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; mso-fareast-font-family: Calibri; mso-fareast-theme-font: minor-latin; mso-ansi-language: EN-GB; mso-fareast-language: EN-GB; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">4108 signal in auto mode is not a valid condition as far as the runsdsall compiler is concerned.&nbsp;Steps including signal in auto mode as a condition can therefore not be included in the data.&nbsp;&nbsp;A suggested way round this, is for a latch to be provided in the SSI which we can then use as a condition.&nbsp;Could a latch be provided?&nbsp;</SPAN>
